Indicator: 'Number of Businesses that are Arts-Related per 1

column8: musical groups and artists (711130)
column9: other performing arts companies (711190)

Indicator: Number of Employees in the Creative Economy
Definition: The number of persons employed in the creative economy (both for-profit and non-profit). This number does not count those persons who identify themselves as being artists and does not count sole proprietorships or persons who work part-time in the arts. The same industries used to calculate the rate businesses in the creative economy are used to calculate total employment in the creative economy.

Definition: libcard
column5: ' The rate of persons per 1
column6: 000 residents that possess a valid public library system card. This includes all library card types (first card
column8: young adult
column9: adult).  '

Indicator: Number of Public Murals
Definition: 'The number of murals per CSA. Murals are also included in the “Public Art per 1
column5: 000 residents” indicator. Murals are separated out as a sub-indicator so they can be analyzed at the point-level.'

Indicator: 'Rate of Businesses in the Creative Economy per 1
Definition: cebus
column5: 'The rate of businesses (both for-profit and non-profit) that are in the creative economy per 1
column6: 000 residents. The creative economy is defined as industries that use and support artistic and cultural skillsets to attract and generate capital
column8: and information. Arts-based businesses are included in the creative economy. In addition to the industries included in the rate of arts-based businesses indictor
column9: the following industries are identified by their primary NAICS code: Textiles (313220); Commercial Printing (323111
column15: 519110); Motion Picture & Video Production (512110); Music Publishers (512230); Sound Recording (512240); Radio (515112); Architecture (541310
column18: 541922). In addition to the industries included in the rate of arts-based businesses indictor
column19: the following industries are identified by their primary SIC code: Print Media (271101
column47: 738401); Graphic Design (733603); Commercial Artists (733604); Website Design (737311); General Media (738301); Interior Design (738902); Restoration (764112); Landscape Design (781030); Motion Picture and Video Support (781205

Indicator: Total Employment in Arts-Related Businesses
Definition: The number of persons employed in arts-related businesses (both for-profit and non-profit). This number does not count those persons who identify themselves as being artists and does not count sole proprietorships or persons who work part-time in the arts. The same industries are used to determine the rate of arts-related businesses.

Indicator: 'Domestic Violence Calls For Service per 1
Definition: domvio
column5: 'The rate of calls to emergency 911 for domestic violence per 1
column6: 000 residents in an area. Calls for service are used rather than actual crime incidents since domestic violence can be classified as one of several types of criminal offenses. It is important to also note that not every case of domestic violence is reported and some claims of abuse may be unfounded.  '

Indicator: 'Juvenile Arrest Rate for Drug-Related Offenses per 1
Definition: juvdrug
column5: 'The number of persons aged 10 to 17 for drug-related offenses per 1
column6: 000 juveniles that live in an area. Drug-related offenses include arrests for possession
column8: manufacture
column9: or abuse of illegal drugs
column10: including alcohol. This indicator is calculated by where the arrested juvenile was arrested and not by where the crime is committed. Arrests are used instead of crimes committed since not all juveniles that are arrested are charged with committing a crime. This indicator also excludes offenders who are later charged as adults for their crime(s).'

Indicator: 'Juvenile Arrest Rate for Violent Offenses per 1
Definition: juvviol
column5: 'The number of persons aged 10 to 17 arrested for violent offenses per 1
column6: 000 juveniles that live in an area. Violent offenses may include homicide
column8: assault (with or without a weapon)
column9: and robbery. This indicator is calculated by where the arrested juvenile was arrested and not by where the crime is committed. Arrests are used instead of crimes committed since not all juveniles that are arrested are charged with committing a crime. This indicator also excludes offenders who are later charged as adults for their crime(s).'

Indicator: 'Juvenile Arrest Rate per 1
Definition: juvarr
column5: 'The number of persons aged 10 to 17 arrested per 1
column6: 000 juveniles that live in an area. This indicator is calculated by where the arrested juvenile was arrested and not by where the crime is committed. Arrests are used instead of crimes committed since not all juveniles that are arrested are charged with committing a crime. This indicator also excludes offenders who are later charged as adults for their crime(s).'

Indicator: 'Number of Arrests per 1
Definition: arrest
column5: 'The number of adult arrests per 1
column6: 000 adults aged 18+. '

column6: 000 residents in an area. Since the data comes from 911 calls
column7: it is possible that multiple calls could be made for a single incident. Additionally
column8: not every accident involving a motor vehicle is reported to the Police Department. '

Indicator: 'Number of Common Assault Calls for Service per 1
Definition: caslt
column5: 'The rate of calls for assaults that do not involve a weapon per 1
column6: 000 residents in an area. Since the data comes from 911 calls
column7: it is possible that multiple calls could be made for a single incident.        '

Indicator: 'Number of Gun-Related Homicides per 1
Definition: gunhom
column5: 'The rate of homicides by firearm as reported in the Part 1 crime data per 1

Indicator: 'Number of Narcotics Calls for Service per 1
Definition: narc

column7: it is possible that multiple calls could be made for a single incident. '

Indicator: 'Number of Shootings per 1
Definition: shoot
column5: 'The rate of 911 calls for shootings per 1
column6: 000 residents in an area. Since the data comes from 911 calls
column7: it is possible that multiple calls could be made for a single incident.'

column6: rape
column8: robbery
column9: burglary
column11: and auto theft that are reported to the Police Department. These incidents are per 1
column12: 000 residents in the neighborhood to allow for comparison across areas.'

Indicator: 'Property Crime Rate per 1
Definition: prop
column5: 'The property crime rate measures the number of Part 1 crimes identified as being property-based (burglary and auto theft) that are reported to the Police Department. These incidents are per 1
column6: 000 residents in the neighborhood to allow for comparison across areas.  '

Indicator: 'Violent Crime Rate per 1

column5: 'The violent crime rate measures the number of Part 1 crimes identified as being violent (homicide
column6: rape
column8: and robbery) that are reported to the Police Department. These incidents are per 1
column9: 000 residents in the neighborhood to allow for comparison across areas.'

column10: and Recreation (NAICS 71); Accommodation and Food Services (NAICS 72); and Other Services except Public Administration (NAICS 81). The primary industry reported by each business was used to deter-mine their inclusion. '

Indicator: 'Number of Banks and Bank Branches per 1
Definition: banks
column5: 'The number of banks and bank branches per 1
column6: 000 residents within an area. '

Indicator: Number of Businesses by Selected Neighborhood Industry (NAICS Sectors)
Definition: 'The number of businesses (both for-profit and non-profit) that provide products and services to local residents. The industries included in this indicator are: Retail Trade (NAICS 44-45); Finance and Insurance (NAICS 52); Professional
column5: Scientific
column6: and Technical Services (NAICS 54); Health Care and Social Assistance (NAICS 62); Arts
column8: and Recreation (NAICS 71); Accommodation and Food Services (NAICS 72); and Other Services except Public Administration (NAICS 81). The primary industry reported by each business was used to determine their inclusion.            '

Indicator: Number of Businesses with Under 50 Employees
Definition: The total number of businesses (both for-profit and non-profit) that report having less than 50 persons employed within an area at a single time in a year.

Indicator: Number of Total Jobs Filled by Employees
Definition: Measures the number of total jobs per CSA (only counts jobs that are currently held by employees)

Indicator: Percent  Population (25 years and over) With High School Diploma
Definition: 'The percentage of persons that have completed
column5: graduated
column6: or received a high school diploma or GED. This is a standard indicator used to measure the portion of the population with a basic level of skills needed for the workplace. Persons under the age of 25 are not included in this analysis since many of these persons are still attending various levels of schooling.        '

Indicator: Percent  Population (25 years and over) With Less Than a High School Diploma or GED
Definition: 'The percentage of persons that have not completed
column5: graduated
column6: or received a high school diploma or GED. This is a standard indicator used to measure the portion of the population with less than a basic level of skills needed for the workplace. Persons under the age of 25 are not included in this analysis since many of these persons are still attending various levels of schooling.        '

Indicator: Percent  Population (25 years and over) with Some College Education and Above
Definition: 'The percentage of persons that have completed
column5: graduated
column6: or received a high school diploma or GED and also either taken some college courses
column8: Bachelor’s
column9: or an advanced degree. This is an indicator used to measure the portion of the population having an advanced level of skills needed for the workplace. Persons under the age of 25 are not included in this analysis since many of these persons are still attending various levels of schooling.        '

Indicator: Percent  Population 16-64 Employed
Definition: 'The number of persons between the ages of 16 and 64 formally employed or self-employed and earning a formal income. It is used to understand how many persons are working out of the entire population
column5: not just those in the labor force (persons who may be looking for work or working).        '

Indicator: Percent  Population 16-64 Not in Labor Force
Definition: The number of persons who are not in the labor force out of all persons between the ages of 16 and 64 in the area. There are several reasons why persons may not be included in the labor force. These reasons may include: they are caretakers for children or other family members; they attend school or job training; they may have a disability; and they are discouraged or frustrated and have given up seeking a job or have a history that may include criminal activity.

Indicator: Percent  Population 16-64 Unemployed and Looking for Work
Definition: 'The number of persons between the ages of 16 and 64 not working out of all persons
column5: not just those in the labor force (persons who may be looking for work). These persons are seeking work that pays a formal income.  '

Indicator: Percent of Businesses that are 1 year old or less
Definition: The percentage of businesses (both for-profit and non-profit) that report their establishment as being one year old or less. The age of the business is determined by the year that the first year they appeared in the InfoUSA database.

Indicator: Percent of Businesses that are 2 years old or less
Definition: The percentage of businesses (both for-profit and non-profit) that report their establishment as being two years old or less. The age of the business is determined by the year that the first year they appeared in the business database.

Indicator: Percent of Businesses that are 4 years old or less
Definition: The percentage of businesses (both for-profit and non-profit) that report their establishment as being four years old or less. The age of the business is determined by the year that the first year they appeared in the business database. A business that has been in operation more than four years has a greater likelihood of remaining open for a longer period of time.

Indicator: 'Percent of Commercial Properties with Rehab Permits Above $5
Definition: crehab
column5: 'The percentage of properties that are investing within their current establishment and not the level of their investment. Permits for work below $5
column6: 000 are considered to be minor and not included in this indicator. A single establishment can apply for and receive multiple permits.    '

Indicator: Percent of Employed Residents who Work Outside the City
Definition: The percentage of workers that are employed by jobs located outside of Baltimore City. Only persons who report being employed and are at least 16 years old are included in the analysis.

Indicator: Total Number of Businesses
Definition: The total number of businesses (both for-profit and non-profit) within an area at a single time in a year.

Indicator: Total Number of Commercial Properties
Definition: The total number of commercial properties located within an area in a particular year.

Indicator: Total Number of Employees
Definition: The total number of persons employed by businesses (both for-profit and non-profit) within an area at a single time in a year.

Indicator: Total number of Employees by Selected Neighborhood Industry (NAICS Sectors)
Definition: 'The number of persons employed by businesses (both for-profit and non-profit) that provide products and services to local residents. The industries included in this indicator are: Retail Trade (NAICS 44-45); Finance and Insurance (NAICS 52); Professional
column5: Scientific
column6: and Technical Services (NAICS 54); Health Care and Social Assistance (NAICS 62); Arts
column8: and Recreation (NAICS 71); Accommodation and Food Services (NAICS 72); and Other Services except Public Administration (NAICS 81). The primary industry reported by each business was used to determine their inclusion. The persons employed by these businesses may not necessarily live in the neighborhood where the business is located.            '

Indicator: Unemployment Rate
Definition: The number of persons between the ages of 16 and 64 that are in the labor force (and are looking for work) but are not currently working.

Indicator: High School Completion Rate
Definition: The percentage of 12th graders in a school year that successfully completed high school out of all 12th graders within an area. Completers are identified as completing their program of study at the high school level and satisfying the graduation requirements for a Maryland High School Diploma or the requirements for a Maryland Certificate of Program Completion

Indicator: High School Dropout/Withdraw Rate
Definition: 'The percentage of 9th through 12th graders who withdraw from public school out of all high school students in a school year. Withdraw codes are used as a proxy for dropping out of school based upon the expectation that withdrawn students are no longer receiving educational services. A dropout is defined as a student who
column5: for any reason other than death
column6: leaves school before graduation or the completion of a Maryland-approved education program and is not known to enroll in another school or State-approved program during a current school year.'

Indicator: Kindergarten School Readiness
Definition: 'The percentage of children whose composite score indicates full school readiness out of all kindergarten school children tested within an area in a school year. The Maryland Model for School Readiness (MMSR) is an assessment and instructional system that was designed to provide parents
column5: teachers
column6: and early childhood providers with a common understanding of what children know and are able to do upon entering school. Under the MMSR system
column7: all children entering kindergarten are assessed for level of mastery across several learning domains. These domains include: social and personal development; language and literacy; mathematical thinking; scientific thinking; social studies; the arts; and physical development and health. Kindergarten teachers must evaluate students during the first few months of the kindergarten year using selected Work Sampling System (WSS) indicators and report their ratings by the end of November of each year to the state. '

Indicator: Number of Students Ever Attended 1st - 5th Grade
Definition: The number of children who have registered for and attend 1st through 5th grade at a Baltimore City Public School at any point during the school year.

Indicator: Number of Students Ever Attended 6th - 8th Grade
Definition: The number of children who have registered for and attend 6th through 8th grade at a Baltimore City Public School at any point in the school year.

Indicator: Number of Students Ever Attended 9th - 12th Grade
Definition: The number of children who have registered for and attend 9th through 12th grade at a Baltimore City Public School at any point in the school year.

Indicator: Number of Students Officially Enrolled in 1st - 5th Grade
Definition: The number of children who have registered for and attend 1st through 5th grade at a Baltimore City Public School as of September 30th. This count only includes students enrolled in public schools.

Indicator: Number of Students Officially Enrolled in 6th - 8th Grade
Definition: The number of children who have registered for and attend 6th through 8th grade at a Baltimore City Public School as of September 30th. This count only includes students enrolled in public schools.

Indicator: Number of Students Officially Enrolled in 9th - 12th Grade
Definition: The number of children who have registered for and attend 9th through 12th grade at a Baltimore City Public School as of September 30th. This count only includes students enrolled in public schools.

Indicator: Percent of 1st-5th Grade Students that are Chronically Absent (Missing at least 20 days)
Definition: The percentage of 1st-5th grade students that were recognized as being absent from public school 20 or more days out of all students.

Indicator: Percent of 6th-8th Grade Students that are Chronically Absent (Missing at least 20 days)
Definition: The percentage of 6th-8th grade students that were recognized as being absent from public school 20 or more days out of all students.

Indicator: Percent of 9th-12th Grade Students that are Chronically Absent (Missing at least 20 days)
Definition: The percentage of 9th-12th grade students that were recognized as being absent from public school 20 or more days out of all students.

Indicator: Percent of Students Switching Schools within School Year
Definition: 'The percentage of 1st through 12th graders who change schools out of all students in a school year. Students must have attended both schools for which they were registered for at least one day.  Additionally
column5: this indicator only identifies the share of students that change schools for any reasons and not the frequency
column6: number of school switches
column7: or change in residences in a school year.  The percentage reflects the last home address available for the student who changed schools.  This may or may not be the home address provided for the first school that they are registered to attend.  '

Indicator: Percent of Students that are African American (non-Hispanic)
Definition: The percentage of Black/African American students of any grade that attend any Baltimore City Public School out of all public school students within an area in a school year.

Indicator: Percent of Students that are Hispanic
Definition: The percentage of students of any grade level who identify their ethnicity as being Hispanic that attend any Baltimore City Public School out of all public school students within an area in a school year. Ethnicity is separate from a student’s race.

Indicator: Percent of Students that are White (non-Hispanic)
Definition: The percentage of white (non-Hispanic) students of any grade that attend any Baltimore City Public School out of all public school students within an area in a school year.

Definition: 'The percentages of students passing M.S.A. exams in reading and mathematics in 3rd
column5: 5th
column6: and 8th grades. Maryland School Assessment (MSA) scores measure the number of students scoring in one of three classifications out of all students enrolled in that grade. Students can either be rated as advanced
column8: or having basic knowledge of a subject. This indicator includes only those students who have tested as advanced or proficient.'

Definition: 'The percentages of students passing M.S.A. exams in reading and mathematics in 3rd

Definition: 'The percentages of students passing M.S.A. exams in reading and mathematics in 3rd

Indicator: Percentage of 8th Grade Students Passing MSA Reading
Definition: 'The percentages of students passing M.S.A. exams in reading and mathematics in 3rd
column5: 5th
column6: and 8th grades. Maryland School Assessment (MSA) scores measure the number of students scoring in one of three classifications out of all students enrolled in that grade. Students can either be rated as advanced

Indicator: Percentage of Population aged 16-19 in School and/or Employed
Definition: The percentage of persons aged 16 to 19 who are in school and/or are employed out of all persons in their age cohort.

Indicator: Percentage of Students Enrolled in Special Education Programs
Definition: The percentage of students of any grade that are eligible for and participating in public school special education programs out of all students. This includes all students with any diagnosed disability

Indicator: Percentage of Students Passing H.S.A. Algebra
Definition: 'The percentage of high school students who have successfully passed the H.S.A. exams out of all high school students that took the exam in the school year (considering only the highest score per subject area). In Maryland
column5: all students who entered 9th grade in or after 2005 are required to take and pass the High School Assessments (H.S.A.) in order to graduate
column6: including students in special education
column8: and students with 504 plans. There are currently three H.S.A. exams: English
column9: Algebra/Data Analysis; and Biology (a H.S.A. in Government has since been discontinued). Students can retake the HSAs as many times as necessary to pass.'

Indicator: Percentage of Students Passing H.S.A. Biology
Definition: 'The percentage of high school students who have successfully passed the H.S.A. exams out of all high school students that took the exam in the school year (considering only the highest score per subject area). In Maryland

column6: including students in special education
column8: and students with 504 plans. There are currently three H.S.A. exams: English
column9: Algebra/Data Analysis; and Biology (a H.S.A. in Government has since been discontinued). Students can retake the HSAs as many times as necessary to pass.'

Indicator: Percentage of Students Passing H.S.A. English
Definition: 'The percentage of high school students who have successfully passed the H.S.A. exams out of all high school students that took the exam in the school year (considering only the highest score per subject area). In Maryland

column6: including students in special education
column8: and students with 504 plans. There are currently three H.S.A. exams: English
column9: Algebra/Data Analysis; and Biology (a H.S.A. in Government has since been discontinued). Students can retake the HSAs as many times as necessary to pass.'

Indicator: Percentage of Students Passing H.S.A. Government
Definition: 'The percentage of high school students who have successfully passed the H.S.A. exams out of all high school students that took the exam in the school year (considering only the highest score per subject area). In Maryland

column9: Algebra/Data Analysis; and Biology (a H.S.A. in Government has since been discontinued). Students can retake the HSAs as many times as necessary to pass.'

Indicator: Percentage of Students Receiving Free or Reduced Meals
Definition: The percentage of students of any grade that are eligible for and receive free or reduced school meals out of all public school students. Eligibility for this program is based on the student’s household income.

Indicator: Percentage of Students Suspended or Expelled During School Year
Definition: The percentage of students of any grade level that are formally suspended or expelled for any reason during the school year out of all public school students within an area.

Indicator: Average Healthy Food Availability Index
Definition: 'The Johns Hopkins Center for a Livable Future (CLF) calculated HFAI scores for all food stores in Baltimore
column5: in summer 2012
column6: using an adapted version of the NEMS-S (Nutrition Environment Measures Survey in Stores) tool.  The NEMS-S tool was developed by researchers at the Rollins School of Public Health at Emory University to measure the nutritional environment of food retail stores and was designed to assess healthy food availability in grocery and convenience stores.  CLF obtained a food permit list from the Baltimore City Health Department in August 2011
column7: which includes all sites that sell food
column8: such as stores
column9: restaurants
column10: and temporary locations such as farmers’ market stands and street carts.  HFAI scores range from zero to 28.5
column11: with higher scores indicating more availability of healthy and whole food in a food store.'

Indicator: 'Fast Food Outlet Density (per 1
Definition: fastfd
column5: 'The Johns Hopkins Center for a Livable Future (CLF) obtained the food permit list from the Baltimore City Health Department in August 2011
column6: which includes all sites that sell food
column8: restaurants and temporary locations such as farmers’ market stands and street carts. The restaurants were grouped into three categories
column9: including full service restaurants
column10: fast food chains and carryouts. Carryout and fast food chain restaurants were extracted from the restaurant layer and spatially joined with the 2010 Community Statistical Area (CSA) data layer
column11: provided by BNIA-JFI. The prepared foods density
column14: was calculated for each CSA using the CSA’s population and the total number of carryout and fast food restaurants
column15: including vendors selling prepared foods in public markets

Indicator: Infant Mortality
Definition: 'The number of infant deaths (babies under one year of age) per 1
column5: 000 live births within the area in a five year period.  This is the most stable and commonly measured indicator of mortality in this age group. '

Indicator: Life Expectancy
Definition: 'The average number of years a newborn can expect to live
column5: assuming he or she experiences the currently prevailing rates of death through their lifespan.  '

Indicator: 'Liquor Outlet density (per 1
Definition: liquor
column5: 'This indicator reflects the number of business establishments that possess a Class A (Off Sale package goods no on-premises consumption - 6 days
column6: 6:00 a.m.- Midnight. No Sunday sales except Sundays between Thanksgiving Day and New Year''s Day upon issuance of a special license for each Sunday) or BD7 (tavern) business license that allows them to sell beer
column8: or liquor. Other liquor licenses to restaurants or on-premise consumption were not included in this analysis. This number is provided by 1
column9: 000 residents to allow for comparison across neighborhoods'

Indicator: Mortality by Age (1-14 years old)
Definition: 'The number of deaths of persons between the ages of one and 14 per 10
column5: 000 persons within the area in a five year period.  '

Indicator: Mortality by Age (15-24 years old)
Definition: 'The number of deaths of persons between the ages of 15 and 24 per 10
column5: 000 persons within the area in a five year period.'

Indicator: Mortality by Age (25-44 years old)
Definition: 'The number of deaths of persons between the ages of 25 and 44 per 10
column5: 000 persons within the area in a five year period'

Indicator: Mortality by Age (45-64 years old)
Definition: 'The number of deaths of persons between the ages of 45 and 64 per 10
column5: 000 persons within the area in a five year period.  '

Indicator: Mortality by Age (65-84 years old)
Definition: 'The number of deaths of persons between the ages of 65 and 84 per 10
column5: 000 persons within the area in a five year period.'

Indicator: Mortality by Age (85 and over)
Definition: 'The number of deaths of persons 85 years and older per 10
column5: 000 persons within the area in a five year period.  '

Indicator: Number of Children (aged 0-6) Tested for Elevated Blood Lead Levels
Definition: This indicator reflects the total number of children aged 0-6 who are tested for the presence of blood lead in a calendar year.

Indicator: Percent of Babies Born with a Satisfactory Birth Weight
Definition: The percentage of children born with a birth weight of at least 5 ½ pounds out of all births in the area.

Indicator: Percent of Births Delivered at Term (37-42 Weeks)
Definition: The percentage of births delivered at term measures the percentage of births in a calendar year where the baby is delivered between 37 and 42 weeks of gestation.

Indicator: Percent of Births Where the Mother Received Early Prenatal Care (First Trimester)
Definition: The percentage of births where the mother received prenatal care during the first trimester of the pregnancy in a calendar year out of all births within an area. This information is calculated by the Vital Statistics registration information collected from each live birth.

Indicator: Percent of Children (aged 0-6) with Elevated Blood Lead Levels
Definition: The number of children aged 0-6 that are found to either have elevated blood lead levels  (≥10Mg/dL) or lead poisoning (≥20 Mg/dL) out of the number of children tested within an area in a calendar year.

Indicator: Percent of Families Receiving TANF
Definition: 'Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) is a federal assistance program. The Act provides temporary financial assistance while aiming to get people off of that assistance
column5: primarily through employment.  '

Indicator: 'Percent of Lead Violations per 1
Definition: leadv

Indicator: 'Teen Pregnancy Rate per 1
Definition: teenbir
column5: 'The rate of female teens aged 15-19 that gave birth per 1
column6: 000 females aged 15-19.     '

Indicator: Affordability Index - Mortgage
Definition: The percentage of households that pay more than 30% of their total household income on mortgage and other housing-related expenses

Indicator: Affordability Index - Rent
Definition: The percentage of households that pay more than 30% of their total household income on rent and related expenses out of all households in an area.

Indicator: Median Number of Days on the Market
Definition: The median number of days that homes listed for sale sits on the public market in a given area.  This time period is from the date it is listed for sale till the day the contract of sale is signed.  Private (non-listed) home sale transactions are not included in this indicator.  The median days on market is used as opposed to the average so that both extremely high and extremely low days on the market do not distort the length of time for which homes are listed on the market.

Indicator: Median Price of Homes Sold
Definition: The median home sales price is the middle value of the prices for which homes are sold (both market and private transactions) within a calendar year.  The median value is used as opposed to the average so that both extremely high and extremely low prices do not distort the prices for which homes are sold.  This measure does not take into account the assessed value of a property.

Indicator: 'Number of Demolition Permits per 1
Definition: demper
column5: 'The number of permits issued for the demolition of residential buildings per 1
column6: 000 existing residential properties.  The permits are analyzed by date of issue and not date of actual demolition.        '

Indicator: 'Number of Homeowner''s Tax Credits per 1
Definition: owntax
column5: 'The number of residential properties that received the homeowners tax credit per 1
column6: 000 residential properties within an area.  The homeowner’s tax credit sets a limit on the amount of property taxes any homeowner must pay based upon his or her income.'

Indicator: Number of Homes Sold
Definition: The portion of the homes and condominiums sold that were identified as being owned by the bank (REO) out of all residential properties sold in a calendar year.

Indicator: 'Number of Homestead Tax Credits per 1
Definition: homtax
column5: 'The number of residential properties that received the homestead tax credit per 1
column6: 000 residential properties within an area.  The Homestead Credit limits the increase in taxable assessments each year to a fixed percentage. Every county and municipality in Maryland is required to limit taxable assessment increases to 10% or less each year
column7: with the Baltimore City rate capped at 4%.'

Indicator: 'Number of New Construction Permits per 1
Definition: constper
column5: 'The number of permits issued for new residential buildings per 1
column6: 000 existing residential properties within a community.  The permits are analyzed by date of issue and not date of completion.        '

Indicator: Percent Residential Properties that do Not Receive Mail
Definition: 'The percentage of residential addresses for which the United States Postal Service has identified as being unoccupied (no mail collection) for a period of at least 90 days or longer.  These properties may be habitable
column5: but are not currently being occupied.  It is important to note that a single residential property can contain more than one address.'

Indicator: Percentage of Housing Units that are Owner-Occupied
Definition: The percentage of homeowners that are the principal residents of a particular residential property out of all residential properties.  It is important to note that a portion of these owner-occupied properties may be subdivided and have tenants that pay rent and are not included in the calculation.

Indicator: Percentage of Properties Under Mortgage Foreclosure
Definition: The percentage of properties where the  lending company or loan servicer has filed a foreclosure proceeding with the Baltimore City Circuit Court out of all residential properties within an area.  This is not a measure of actual foreclosures since not every property that receives a filing results in a property dispossession.

Indicator: 'Percentage of Properties with Rehabilitation Permits Exceeding $5
Definition: resrehab
column5: 'The portion of residential properties that have applied for and received a permit to renovate the interior and/or exterior of a property where the cost of renovation will exceed $5
column6: 000.  The threshold of $5
column7: 000 is used to differentiate a minor and more significant renovation project. '

Indicator: Percentage of Residential Properties that are Vacant and Abandoned
Definition: The percentage of residential properties that have been classified as being vacant and abandoned by the Baltimore City Department of Housing out of all properties.  Properties are classified as being vacant and abandoned if: the property is not habitable and appears boarded up or open to the elements; the property was designated as being vacant prior to the current year and still remains vacant; and the property is a multi-family structure where all units are considered to be vacant.

Indicator: Percentage of Residential Properties with Housing Violations (Excluding Vacants)
Definition: 'The percentage of residential properties that have received at least one housing code violation from the Baltimore City Department of Housing out of all properties.  Properties whose façade
column5: structure
column6: and/or surrounding area violate the City’s Housing Code are issued a notice and are considered open till the property is found in compliance. A property may receive multiple violations.  '

Indicator: Percentage of Residential Sales for Cash
Definition: The portion of homes and condominiums sold for cash out of all residential properties sold in a calendar year. These types of sales tend to signify investor-based purchases as homes purchased for cash either become rental properties or later sold again in an effort to generate a profit.

Indicator: Percentage of Residential Sales in Foreclosure (REO)
Definition: The percentage of properties where the  lending company or loan servicer has filed a foreclosure proceeding with the Baltimore City Circuit Court out of all residential properties within an area.  This is not a measure of actual foreclosures since not every property that receives a filing results in a property dispossession.

Indicator: Percentage of Vacant Properties Owned by Baltimore City
Definition: 'The percent of properties that are classified as being vacant and abandoned that are owned by Baltimore City.  Baltimore City has come to own these properties through a variety of ways including (but not limited to) eminent domain
column5: unpaid tax or water bills
column6: and purchase'

Indicator: 'Rate of Housing Vouchers per 1
Definition: hcvhouse
column5: The number of Housing Choice Vouchers held by households divided by total rental units.

Indicator: Total Number of Residential Properties
Definition: 'The total number of residential properties located within an area as identified by Maryland Property View.  It is important to note that that this indicator is a count of properties (single family homes
column5: condominiums
column6: and duplexes) and that a property can be comprised of multiple housing units.  '

Indicator: Average Household Size
Definition: The median value of number of persons living within a household.  The average size of a household is obtained by dividing the number of persons in households by the number of households (or householders).

Indicator: Median Household Income
Definition: The median household income is the middle value of the incomes earned by households within an area for the prior year.  The median value is used as opposed to the average so that both extremely high and extremely low prices do not distort the total amount of income earned by households in an area.

Indicator: Percent of Children Living Below the Poverty Line
Definition: This indicator measures the percentage of persons under the age of 18 living in households where the total income fell below the poverty threshold out of all children in households in an area.  Federal and state governments use such estimates to allocate funds to local communities. Local communities use these estimates to identify the number of individuals or families eligible for various programs.

Indicator: Percent of Family Households Living Below the Poverty Line
Definition: This indicator measures the percentage of households whose income fell below the poverty threshold out of all households in an area.  Federal and state governments use such estimates to allocate funds to local communities. Local communities use these estimates to identify the number of individuals or families eligible for various programs.

Indicator: Percent of Female-Headed Households with Children Under 18
Definition: The percentage of female-headed households with children under 18 out of all households with children under 18 in an area.

Indicator: 'Percent of Households Earning $25
Definition: Socioeconomic/Demographics
column5: hh40inc
column6: 'The percentage of households earning between $25
column8: 999 out of all households in an area.      '

Indicator: 'Percent of Households Earning $40
Definition: Socioeconomic/Demographics
column5: hh60inc
column6: 'The percentage of households earning between $40
column8: 999 out of all households in an area.      '

Indicator: 'Percent of Households Earning $60
Definition: Socioeconomic/Demographics
column5: hh75inc
column6: 'The percentage of households earning between $60
column8: 999 out of all households in an area.      '

Indicator: 'Percent of Households Earning Less than $25
Definition: hh25inc
column5: 'The percentage of households earning less than $25
column6: 000 out of all households in an area.    '

Indicator: 'Percent of Households Earning More than $75
Definition: hhm75
column5: 'The percentage of households earning more than $75
column6: 000 out of all households in an area.      '

Indicator: Percent of Households with Children Under 18
Definition: The percentage of households with children living in the household that are under the age of 18 out of all households.

Indicator: Percent of Population 0-5 years old
Definition: The percent of persons 5 years or under out of all persons living in an area.

Indicator: Percent of Population 19-24 years old
Definition: The percent of persons aged 19 to 24 years old out of all persons living in an area.

Indicator: Percent of Population 25-64 years old
Definition: The percent of persons aged 25 to 64 years old out of all persons living in an area.

Indicator: Percent of Population 6-18 years old
Definition: The percent of persons aged 6 to 18 years old out of all persons living in an area.

Indicator: Percent of Population 65 years and over
Definition: The total number of persons 65 years old and above out of all persons living in an area.

Indicator: 'Percent of Residents - All Other Races (Hawaiian/ Pacific Islander
Definition: ppac
column5: 'The total number of persons that identify themselves as being of either American Indian
column6: Alaskan Native
column7: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
column8: or some other race (non-Hispanic) out of the total number of persons living in an area. '

Indicator: Percent of Residents - Asian (Non-Hispanic)
Definition: 'The total number of persons that identify themselves as being Asian (and non-Hispanic) out of the total number of persons living in an area.  “Asian” refers to a person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East
column5: Southeast Asia
column6: or the Indian subcontinent
column8: for example
column9: Cambodia

Indicator: Percent of Residents - Black/African-American (Non-Hispanic)
Definition: The total number of persons that identify themselves as being racially Black or African American (and ethnically non-Hispanic) out of the total number of persons living in an area.  “Black or African American” refers to a person having origins in any of the Black racial groups of Africa. It includes people who indicated their race as “Black”.

Indicator: Percent of Residents - Hispanic
Definition: 'The total number of persons that identify their ethnicity as being Hispanic or Latino out of the total number of persons living in an area. Hispanic origin can be viewed as the heritage
column5: nationality group
column6: lineage
column7: or country of birth of the person or the person’s parents or ancestors before their arrival in the United States. People who identify their origin as Hispanic
column8: Latino
column9: or Spanish may be any race.  '

Indicator: Percent of Residents - Two or More Races (Non-Hispanic)
Definition: The total number of persons that identify themselves as being of two or more races (and non-Hispanic) out of the total number of persons living in an area.

Indicator: Percent of Residents - White/Caucasian (Non-Hispanic)
Definition: 'The total number of persons that identify themselves as being racially White (and ethnically non-Hispanic) out of the total number of persons living in an area.   “White” refers to a person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe
column5: the Middle East
column6: or North Africa. It includes people who indicated their race(s) as “White”.   '

Indicator: Racial Diversity Index
Definition: 'The percent chance that two people picked at random within an area will be of a different race/ethnicity.  This number does not reflect which race/ethnicity is predominant within an area.  The higher the value
column5: the more racially and ethnically diverse an area.   '

Indicator: Total Female Population
Definition: The total number of women of all ages that live within an area.

Indicator: Total Male Population
Definition: The total number of men of all ages of all ages that live within an area.

Indicator: Total Number of Households
Definition: 'A household consists of all the people occupying a housing unit.  A household includes related and unrelated persons
column5: if any
column6: such as lodgers
column8: wards
column9: or employees who share the housing unit. A person living alone in a housing unit
column10: or a group of unrelated people sharing a housing unit such as partners or roomers
column11: is also counted as a household. The count of households excludes group quarters.        '

Indicator: Total Population
Definition: The total number of persons of all ages that live within an area. This indicator is frequently used to normalize data to allow for comparison across areas.

Indicator: Median Daily Water Consumption
Definition: The median daily average water consumption of all city meters registering greater than 0.0 cubic meters per day.

Indicator: Number of Community Managed Open Spaces
Definition: 'The number of community managed open spaces in an area that include community gardens (food-producing or ornamental)
column5: Adopt-A-Lots
column6: or some other green space managed by the community. '

Indicator: Number of Miles of Bike Lanes
Definition: Measures the linear miles of designated bike lanes within the roadway system.

Indicator: Number of Trees of Planted
Definition: Total number of trees planted.

Indicator: Percent of Area Covered by Trees
Definition: 'The percent of total land area comprised of tree canopy. The primary sources for this land cover layer were 2004 pan-sharpened 1m Ikonos satellite imagery
column5: a normalized Digital Surface Model (nDSM) derived from 2006 LiDAR data
column6: and LiDAR intensity data resulting from the 2006 acquisition. Other sources of data include the City''s planimetric GIS database (building footprints and road casing polygons). The land cover classification was performed using automated object-based image analysis (OBIA) techniques in Definiens Developer/eCognition Server. No accuracy assessment was conducted
column7: but the dataset was thoroughly reviewed at a scale of 1:2000. Over 370 corrections were made to the classification.  '

Indicator: Percent of Employed Population with Travel Time to Work of 0-14 Minutes
Definition: The percentage of commuters that spend less than 15 minutes commuting to work out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

Indicator: Percent of Employed Population with Travel Time to Work of 15-29 Minutes
Definition: The percentage of commuters that spend between 15 and 29 minutes commuting to work out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

Indicator: Percent of Employed Population with Travel Time to Work of 30-44 Minutes
Definition: The percentage of commuters that spend between 30 and 44 minutes travelling to work out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

Indicator: Percent of Employed Population with Travel Time to Work of 45 Minutes and Over
Definition: The percentage of commuters that spend more than 45 minutes travelling to work out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

Indicator: Percent of Homes Weatherized
Definition: 'The percent of residential properties that were eligible for and received weatherization assistance such as air sealing or furnace replacements. The Weatherization Assistance Program helps eligible low-income households lower their energy costs by increasing the energy efficiency of their homes
column5: while ensuring their health and safety.         '

Indicator: Percent of Households with No Vehicles Available
Definition: The percentage of households that do not have a personal vehicle available for use out of all households in an area.

Indicator: Percent of Population (Over the age of 18) Who are Registered to Vote
Definition: The percentage of persons over the age of 18 registered to vote out of all persons 18 years and over..

Indicator: Percent of Population that Carpool to Work
Definition: The percentage of commuters that carpool out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

Indicator: Percent of Population that Drove Alone to Work
Definition: The percentage of commuters driving alone out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

Indicator: Percent of Population that Uses Public Transportation to Get to Work
Definition: The percentage of commuters that use public transit out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

Indicator: Percent of Population that Walks to Work
Definition: The percentage of commuters that walk to work out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

Indicator: 'Percent of Population Using Other Means to Commute to Work (Taxi
Definition: Other)'
column5: Sustainability
column6: othrcom
column7: The percentage of commuters that use other means to travel to work out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

Indicator: Percent of Residences Heated by Electricity
Definition: The percentage of homes that use electricity for heat and cooking out of all homes.

Indicator: Percent of Residences Heated by Utility Gas
Definition: The percentage of homes that use utility gas for heat and cooking out of all homes.

Indicator: Percent Population (Over the age of 18) Who Voted in the General Election
Definition: The percentage of persons who voted in the last general election out of all registered voters

Indicator: 'Rate of Clogged Storm Drain Reports per 1
Definition: clogged
column5: 'The rate of service requests for addressing clogged storm drains made through Baltimore’s 311 system per 1
column6: 000 residents.  More than one service request may be made for the same issue but is logged as a unique request.'

Indicator: 'Rate of Dirty Streets and Alleys Reports per 1
Definition: dirtyst
column5: 'The rate of service requests for dirty streets and alleys through Baltimore’s 311 system per 1
column6: 000 residents. More than one service request may be made for the same issue but is logged as a unique request.'

Indicator: Walk Score
Definition: 'The Walk Score® is calculated by mapping out the distance to amenities in nine different categories (grocery stores
column5: restaurants
column6: shopping
column8: banks
column9: parks
column12: and entertainment) and are weighted according to importance. The distance to a location
column14: and weights determine a base score of an address
column15: which is then normalized to a score from 0 to 100.  More information on Walk Score can be found at http://www.walkscore.com/.     '
